intro: Neudorfia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Its flowers, which range from white to pale pink, bloom in the spring and summer months. Neudorfia peruviana is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare species due to its limited distribution.
